title: Madhu Malar
content:
Madhu Malar is a 1981 Indian Tamil-language film jointly directed by Santhana Bharathi and P. Vasu. The film stars Pratap Pothen and Suhasini. It was released on 27 November 1981.[1]

Madhu Malar is the second directorial venture of Bharathi-Vasu after Panneer Pushpangal, made earlier the same year.[2]

The music was composed by Gangai Amaran.[3][4]

Nalini Sastry of Kalki praised Gangai Amaran's music, Sekar's cinematography while also panning his camerawork for certain scenes as out of focus while also panning dialogues for being intellectual and panned the ill-suited ending felt it could have been changed and noted the team who showed promise in Panneer Pushpangal did not improve here.[5] According to Bharathiâ€“Vasu, the film failed due to its plot.[6]
